content: Grants for the Secretary of the Interior. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to reserve funds for the Secretary of the Interior for payments to States. The reservation amount is 0.67 percent until a specified fiscal year, and then increases to 0.75 percent for each succeeding fiscal year. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to reserve funds for the Secretary of the Interior for payments to States. The reservation amount increases to 0.75 percent for each succeeding fiscal year. Subsections (b) and (c) are struck, and subsection (d) is redesignated as subsection (b). The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to allocate funds for the Secretary of the Interior to support the special educational needs of Indian children on reservations and out-of-State Indian children in schools under special contracts. Amendments include striking subsections (b) and (c) and redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (b). The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to modify certain sections related to eligibility criteria for funding. This includes changes in section 9101 and section 5477 to streamline the language and clarify eligibility requirements. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended by removing subsection (e) from Section 1122 and making changes to streamline language and clarify eligibility requirements in sections 9101 and 5477. Section 1124(d) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to redesignate paragraphs and subparagraphs, clarify calculations, and provide exceptions for American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of. Exception for American Samoa, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, and US Virgin Islands to receive half of calculated amounts under specified paragraphs. SEC. 4. CONCENTRATION GRANTS TO LOCAL EDUCATIONAL AGENCIES. Section 1124A(a)(1)(B) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include State minimum requirements and restructure certain clauses and items. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include State minimum requirements and restructure certain clauses and items. Additionally, American Samoa, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and the United States Virgin Islands shall each receive one-half of the lesser of the amounts calculated for each jurisdiction under specific clauses. SEC. 5. TARGETED GRANTS TO LOCAL EDUCATIONAL AGENCIES. Section 1125(e) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include exceptions for certain territories, with each receiving half of a specified amount. Each island jurisdiction shall receive half of the calculated amount under subparagraphs (A) and (B) of paragraph (1). SEC. 6. EDUCATION FINANCE INCENTIVE GRANT PROGRAM. Section 1125A(b) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include exceptions for American Samoa and Guam. Exceptions are made for American Samoa, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and the United States Virgin Islands in receiving funding under certain clauses. Additionally, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, American Samoa, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and the United States Virgin Islands are included in certain provisions.
